id="breadcrumb"><div><a href="/">UICHR</a>&nbsp;&raquo;&nbsp;<span id="spanBreadcrumbPageId">Benefits</span></div></div></div><h1>Benefits</h1></div><div id="page"><div class="ptl_page"><div class="pg_alert"><div class=""><div class="ptl_portlet_vertical"><div class="ptl_top_portlet" style="display:none;"></div><span id="ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl09_lblGlobalContent"><h1></h1></span>

</div></div></div><div class="pg_content"><div class=""><div class="ptl_portlet_vertical"><div class="ptl_top_portlet" style="display:none;"></div><div id="ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl13_divContent"><p>The University of Illinois at Chicago and the State of Illinois offer competitive wages, benefit programs and resources for employees. UIC is strongly committed to providing equitable benefit options throughout each stage of employment. Many benefits become effective on the first day of employment. Benefits offered by UIC include health care options, wellness programs, educational opportunities, tuition assistance, vacations, holidays and other leave benefits, and University retirement plans.</p>
<p>Detailed information on specific employee benefits may be found in subsequent sections or on the <a href="https://www.hr.uillinois.edu/benefits">NESSIE</a> website.</p>
<h3>Benefit Overview Orientation</h3>
<p>Benefit Overview Orientation sessions are held on all campuses. Sessions are designed to provide comprehensive materials and information to new benefit-eligible employees. Benefit selection must be completed within the first 30 calendar days of employment. Please see the <a href="https://nessie.uihr.uillinois.edu/pdf/benefits/BenefitsEligibleOverview.pdf">Benefits Overview Guide (PDF)</a> for information and assistance.</p>
<h2>What are Employee Benefits?<a name="sec01" class="jumptag">&nbsp;</a></h2>
<p>The University of Illinois at Chicago provides benefits to employees to enhance their work experience and economic security. Some of these benefits include, but are not limited to:</p>
<ul>
    <li>Health, dental and vision insurance</li>
    <li>Life, disability and AD&amp;D insurance</li>
    <li>A defined benefit pension plan</li>
    <li>403(b) and 457 tax-deferred retirement savings plans</li>
    <li>Flexible spending accounts</li>
    <li>Domestic partner benefits</li>
    <li>Adoption assistance</li>
    <li>Employee assistance program</li>
    <li>Paid holidays each year and floating holidays (see <a href="https://nessie.uihr.uillinois.edu/cf/leave/">LEAVES</a> in NESSIE)</li>
    <li>Vacation and sick time based on the policies for your appointment</li>
    <li>Tuition discounts for staff and children at any U of I campus and select other Illinois Universities according to current University policy</li>
</ul>
<p>Benefits are subject to change at any time.</p>
<h2>Benefits Administration<a name="sec02" class="jumptag"> </a></h2>
<p>State of Illinois benefits are provided by the Group Insurance Act of 1971, which gives the <a href="https://www2.illinois.gov/cms/Pages/default.aspx">State's Department of Central Management Services (CMS)</a> the authority and responsibility to design, administer, negotiate and/or contract for benefits.</p>
<p>Any change in these benefits is decided upon by CMS and becomes effective for all State of Illinois employees. Benefits include:</p>
<ul>
    <li><a href="https://nessie.uihr.uillinois.edu/cf/benefits/index.cfm?Item_ID=55">Health</a></li>
    <li><a href="https://www.hr.uillinois.edu/benefits/segip/parttime">Health Part-Time Employees</a></li>
    <li><a href="https://www.hr.uillinois.edu/benefits/segip/dental/">Dental</a></li>
    <li><a href="https://www.hr.uillinois.edu/benefits/segip/vision">Vision</a></li>
    <li><a href="https://www.hr.uillinois.edu/benefits/lifedisability/life">Life</a></li>
    <li><a href="https://www.hr.uillinois.edu/benefits/lifedisability/add">Accidental Death and Dismemberment</a></li>
    <li><a href="https://nessie.uihr.uillinois.edu/cf/benefits/index.cfm?Item_ID=111">Long Term Care</a> (effective 7/1/2011 no new enrollments accepted)</li>
    <li><a href="https://www.hr.uillinois.edu/benefits/fsa">Flexible Spending Accounts</a></li>
</ul>
<p>The University of Illinois at Chicago also offers optional supplemental benefits. University of Illinois at Chicago benefits are approved by the Board of Trustees and managed by the University. Benefits include:</p>
<ul>
    <li><a href="https://nessie.uihr.uillinois.edu/cf/benefits/index.cfm?Item_ID=85">Life</a> (effective 7/1/2011 no new enrollments accepted)</li>
    <li><a href="https://nessie.uihr.uillinois.edu/cf/benefits/index.cfm?Item_ID=94">Accidental Death and Dismemberment</a></li>
    <li><a href="https://nessie.uihr.uillinois.edu/cf/benefits/index.cfm?Item_ID=103">Long Term Disability</a></li>
    <li><a href="https://nessie.uihr.uillinois.edu/cf/benefits/index.cfm?Item_ID=126">Retirement Plans</a></li>
    <li><a href="https://nessie.uihr.uillinois.edu/cf/benefits/index.cfm?Item_ID=1654">Civil Union Partner Health Insurance</a></li>
    <li><a href="https://nessie.uihr.uillinois.edu/cf/benefits/index.cfm?Item_ID=2774&amp;rlink=1">Adoption Benefit Program</a></li>
</ul>
<p>In addition to the State and University benefits, eligible employees are required to participate in benefits offered through the <a href="http://www.surs.org/">State Universities Retirement System (SURS)</a>. Benefits include:</p>
<ul>
    <li><a href="https://nessie.uihr.uillinois.edu/cf/benefits/index.cfm?Item_ID=127&amp;rlink=1">Retirement</a></li>
    <li><a href="https://nessie.uihr.uillinois.edu/cf/benefits/index.cfm?Item_ID=105">Long Term Disability</a></li>
</ul>
<p>Each year the University of Illinois at Chicago holds an open enrollment period, typically during the month of May, called Benefit Choice. Any change in State or University benefits is implemented at this time and becomes effective the following July 1.</p>
<p>Changes to benefits plans can typically be made only during Benefit Choice or when experiencing a qualifying event. Some plans allow enrollments and changes at any time of the year.</p>
<h2>What Determines Eligibility?<a name="sec03" class="jumptag">&nbsp;</a></h2>
<p>Employee benefits eligibility is determined by several factors, including full or part-time status as well as appointment /classification type (Civil Service, Academic Professional, faculty etc.), job, and in cases of some foreign national employees, tax status.</p>
<p>General Benefits Eligibility</p>
<ul>
    <li>Employees with appointment of 50% time or more and eligible to participate in SURS</li>
    <li>Faculty: 100% time with an appointment that is greater than or equal to, 4.5 months but less than 9 months</li>
    <li>Faculty with 50 &ndash; 99 % of the average weekly hours required of a full-time employee in the same position</li>
    <li>Full time status &ndash; Permanent employees who work 100% of a normal work period</li>
    <li>Please contact UPB Benefits Services to verify benefits eligibility</li>
    <li>J-1 or F-1 visas are not eligible for insurance until the Substantial Presence test has been met. <a href="http://www.obfs.uillinois.edu/payments-foreign-nationals/">OBFS Payments to Foreign Nationals</a> please contact <a href="http://www.obfs.uillinois.edu/payroll/customer-service/">Payroll</a> for further assistance</li>
    <li>See also ELIGIBILITY in NESSIE</li>
</ul>
<p>Employees newly eligible for benefits have 30 calendar days from their hire date or eligibility date to make State Insurance plan elections, including declining insurance coverage.</p>
<p>Failure to elect insurance plans within 30 calendar days results in the following default enrollment for both full and part-time employees:</p>
<ul>
    <li>Quality Care Health Plan (QCHP) including EyeMed Vision</li>
    <li>Quality Care Dental Plan (QCDP)</li>
    <li>Basic Life Insurance - Free 1x annual salary</li>
    <li>NO DEPENDENT COVERAGE will be included</li>
</ul>
<p>Please visit <a href="https://nessie.uihr.uillinois.edu/cf/benefits/">University of Illinois Benefits</a> for full details. Also see <a href="http://illinois.edu/blog/view/1418/92394?count=1&amp;amp;ACTION=DIALOG&amp;amp;sort=asc">Benefit Choice FAQs</a>.</p>
<h2>Employee Benefits Details<a name="sec04" class="jumptag">&nbsp;</a></h2>
<p>Specific details on benefits plans, changes to benefits, and accessing general and personal benefits information are provided in <a href="https://www.hr.uillinois.edu/benefits">NESSIE</a>, including:</p>
<ul>
    <li>403(b), 457, SURS</li>
    <li>403(b) Online Enrollment</li>
    <li>AD&amp;D</li>
    <li>Adoption</li>
    <li>Benefit Choice</li>
    <li>Benefits Summary</li>
    <li>Campus Contact</li>
    <li>Civil Union</li>
    <li>Civil Union and Domestic Partner</li>
    <li>COBRA</li>
    <li>Dental</li>
    <li>Employee Assistance</li>
    <li>FSA</li>
    <li>Forms</li>
    <li>Health</li>
    <li>LTD</li>
    <li>Life</li>
    <li>Medicare</li>
    <li>Providers</li>
    <li>Qualifying Event / State Plan Changes</li>
    <li>Recreation / Wellness</li>
    <li>Shared Benefits</li>
    <li>Travel Assistance</li>
    <li>UPB Contacts</li>
    <li>Vision</li>
</ul>
<p>&nbsp;</p></div>
